noun.description: An estimate or forecast of a future situation or trend based on a study of present ones.
examples: plans based on projections of slow but positive growth
population projection is essential for planning

noun.description: The presentation of an image on a surface, especially a movie screen.
The presentation or promotion of someone or something in a particular way.
examples: the legal profession's projection of an image of altruism

noun.description: A thing that extends outward from something else.
examples: the particle board covered all the sharp projections

noun.description: The action of projecting a figure.
The representation on a plane surface of any part of the surface of the earth or a celestial sphere.

origin: Mid 16th century (in projection (sense 6)): from Latin projectio(n-), from proicere throw forth (see project).
